Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation On 12/22/23, youth was escalated and needed to be redirected.
Youth became escalated later in the medication room and flung
water at a supervisor. The staff member pushed youth out of the
medication room. As a result of being pushed, youth hit a wall,
hitting their head and right elbow. Youth has a bruise that
encompasses the entire elbow and a bump on the right side of the
forehead. Medical attention was not sought, and a body chart was
not completed. There is video footage available.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant
I spoke with Complainant on 01/03/2024. Complainant stated
Youth A alleged to her on 12/27/2023 that Supervisor 1 pushed
her. Complainant stated she observed Youth A with a yellow to
green color bruise on her right elbow and Youth A could not find
the bump on her head. Complainant stated she referred Youth A
to the nurse for an evaluation.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 01/09/2024 at Vista Maria with another
Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth A stated
she was escalated after the Lost Voices concert because she was
rushed to eat and to complete chores. Youth A stated ripping
things is her coping mechanism and she ripped up a paper
snowflake and some of her personal items. Youth A stated
Supervisor 1 called her for medication and she walked in to the
medication room, opened the capsule and poured it into her
mouth. Youth A stated she threw the water from her medication
cup at Supervisor 1 when he questioned whether she took her
medication. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 pushed her left shoulder
causing her to fall and hit her right elbow and the right side of her
head on the hallway wall. Youth A denied tripping. Youth A denied
dumping the capsule contents in to the trash. Youth A stated there
are no witnesses to this incident. Youth A’s right elbow was
observed with a faint, healing bruise mark and without a bump on
her head on 01/09/2024.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 01/09/2024 at Vista Maria with another
Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth B stated
Youth A ripped up things and used profanity towards Supervisor 1.
Youth B stated she did not witness the incident, but heard that
Youth A spit on Supervisor 1 during medication passing. Youth B
was asked about the medication process. Youth B stated a youth
walks in to the medication room, takes their medication, and walks
out of the medication room.
2

Supervisor 1
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 01/09/2024 at Vista Maria with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A needed staff redirection when she
returned from the Lost Voices concert on 12/22/2023. Supervisor
1 stated Youth A was angry and pacing during dinner preparation
and chores. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A came to the medication
room for her 8:00 PM medication and pulled apart a capsule.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A poured a bit of the capsule contents
in her mouth and the rest in the trash. Supervisor 1 stated he told
Youth A this was a medication refusal. Supervisor 1 stated Youth
A took her Melatonin, chewed it with some water, and spit it at
Supervisor 1’s face. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A then turned and
ran out of the medication room and fell to the ground.
Staff Person 1
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 01/09/2024 by phone. Staff Person
1 stated Youth A was upset when she returned from the Lost
Voices concert. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A used profanity
towards staff and refused to go to her room. Staff Person 1 stated
Youth A tore up Christmas decorations before going to take her
medication. Staff Person 1 stated she walked around the corner
and saw Youth A face down on the ground screaming. Staff
Person 1 stated Youth A complained of elbow and head pain and
alleged Supervisor 1 assaulted her. Staff Person 1 stated she
retrieved a frozen water bottle from the freezer for Youth A to put
on her head. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A denied spitting at
Supervisor 1’s face.
Staff Person 2
I interviewed Staff Person 2 on 01/09/2024 by phone. Staff Person
2 stated Youth A was agitated and yelling when she was called for
medication. Staff Person 2 stated she did not see Youth A fall to
the ground, but heard Youth A use profanity and saw Youth A
sitting on the ground. Staff Person 2 did not have additional
information. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A did not complain of
injury.
Documentation
• Supervisor 1 wrote an incident report dated 12/22/2023 at
7:30 PM. It states Youth A returned from the Lost Voices
concert and used profanity towards staff when directed to
wait to wash dishes. At 8:00 PM Youth A destroyed
displayed arts and crafts. Youth A agreed to take her
medication before her chores. Youth A entered the
3

medication room and broke apart a capsule and poured it in
to the trash. Supervisor 1 told Youth A that was a
medication refusal and Youth A demanded her other
medication. Supervisor 1 unsuccessfully redirected Youth A
to step out of the medication room. Supervisor 1 dispensed
Youth A her Melatonin. Youth A chewed it with some water
and spit it on Supervisor 1 and threw the remaining water in
Supervisor 1’s face. Youth A turned around quickly, tripped,
and fell. It states Staff Person 2 de-escalated Youth A.
• Youth A was seen by the nurse on 12/28/2023. Nursing
report states Youth A complained of right elbow and head
pain from being pushed into a wall on 12/22/2023. It states
Youth A has an old bruise on her right elbow and has full
range of motion of her right elbow. Nurse combed through
the top Youth A’s hair where she alleged pain. Swelling,
lesion, and redness were not found on Youth A’s scalp.
• Supervisor 1’s employee file was reviewed. Supervisor 1
was hired in 01/2022. His file contained a verbal warning in
07/2022 and 09/2022 for attendance.
Video
Camera 1 - 12/22/2023 at 7:18 PM video of Miriam Hall hallway
shows Staff Person 1 sitting in a chair at the end of the hallway
and Staff Person 2 in the common area. Youth A is wearing a blue
dress with short black boots with heels. Youth A walks to the
medication room. It does not show Youth A entering the
medication room because another door is partially open blocking
the view. Youth A falls to the ground on her bottom towards the
hallway wall. Staff Person 1 and Staff Person 2 move towards
Youth A. Youth A gets up from the ground on her own. Supervisor
1 is not seen in the video.
Camera 2 – 12/22/2023 at 7:18 PM video of Miriam Hall hallway
shows Youth A standing in the medication room doorway, Youth A
entering the medication room. Youth A exiting the medication
room while falling. Youth A’s right elbow and the right side of her
head hit the base of the hallway wall across the medication room.
Supervisor 1 is not seen in the video.
Tour
The medication room is small. The medication cart is in the right
back corner when standing in the doorway. If one stands in the
middle of the hallway with arms extended to the side, the hallway
wall and medication room doorway can roughly be touched.
4

Another Department of Health and Human Service Worker
completed an investigation without finding.
Analysis It cannot be conclusively determined based on the interviews and
video review if Supervisor 1 pushed Youth A and caused her to
fall. This investigation will be reopened if further information
becomes available.
CONSULTATION
Water bottles should not be placed in the freezer. Frozen water
bottles can be used as weapons.
Please review, decide, and include in the policy and procedure if a
youth is to enter the medication room or stand at the doorway
during medication dispensing.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & R 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to assure
compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238, MCL
722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional finding
Type
Investigation Staff Person 1
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 01/09/2024 by phone. Staff Person
1 stated she did not file a DHHS 3200 Report of Actual or
Suspected Child Abuse and Neglect because Supervisor 1 denied
assaulting Youth A on 12/22/2023.
Complainant met with Youth A on 12/27/2023 and alleged
Supervisor 1 pushed her on 12/22/2023. Complainant filed the
DHHS 3200 Report of Actual or Suspected Child Abuse and
Neglect on 12/27/2023 resulting in this investigation.
Analysis Staff Person 1 failed to file a DHHS 3200 Report of Actual or
Suspected Child Abuse or Neglect on 12/22/2023.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
